definition: to stay out of (hot water, trouble, awkward situation etc)/to avoid (sb)

to open/to start/to turn on/to boil/to write out (a prescription, check, invoice etc)/to operate (a vehicle)/carat (gold)/abbr. for Kelvin, 開爾文|开尔文[Kai1 er3 wen2]/abbr. for 開本|开本[kai1 ben3], book format

sentences.english: He was right, of course, to avoid the mayoralty trap.
sentences.chinese: 当然，他躲开了市长这个圈套倒是正确的。

sentences.english: I swerved to avoid them and hit a fence.
sentences.chinese: 我打方向盘躲开他们，结果撞上了护栏。

sentences.english: Henry almost flinched when he felt the weight of Colleen’s hand on his leg.
sentences.chinese: 感觉到科琳把手放在他腿上时，亨利差点躲开。

sentences.english: Sasuke charges forward and Danzo dodges a sword slash.
sentences.chinese: 佐助冲了过去，团藏躲开了一刀。

sentences.english: As he moved threateningly forward she shrank from him.
sentences.chinese: 当他威吓着逼近时，她躲开了他。

sentences.english: We can evade an elephant, but Duo Bukai a mosquito bite.
sentences.chinese: 我们可以躲开一头大象，却躲不开一只蚊子的叮咬。

sentences.english: I picked up its direction, but it is to avoid the.
sentences.chinese: 我拿起几粒米，洒向它的方向，但它躲开了。

sentences.english: The robber ditched the cops by driving down an alley.
sentences.chinese: 那窃贼把车驶入小巷躲开了警察。

sentences.english: Maria implored her husband to get away from the weaving car.
sentences.chinese: 玛丽娅哀求丈夫，赶紧躲开那辆还在左右蛇行的车。

sentences.english: If it suddenly startles you in your walk， I will step aside and take another path.
sentences.chinese: 如果使你在行走时忽然惊跃，我就躲开另走别路。

sentences.english: The motorist enjoys an unobstructed view of the natural scenery as he drives across the bridge.
sentences.chinese: 躲开交通堵塞，去看看乡村的自然风光，真太惬意了。

sentences.english: They want to escape all the bad news," Suber said.
sentences.chinese: 他们想躲开所有坏消息，”Sauber表示。

sentences.english: This time it was to avoid a pack of rabid humans racing toward the truck.
sentences.chinese: 这次转弯是为躲开一群狂暴地冲卡车跑来的人。

sentences.english: He escaped within just inches of being hit.
sentences.chinese: 仅仅差几英寸，他躲开了被车撞到。

sentences.english: The bird took refuge from the cat in the tree .
sentences.chinese: 那只鸟飞到树上，躲开了猫。

sentences.english: On birthdays, I’d shut the door and take the phone off the hook.
sentences.chinese: 我生日那天我锁好门拿着电话就躲开朋友们了。

definition: to evade/to dodge (out of the way)
to get out of the way
to hide/to evade/to dodge/to take shelter/to avoid (difficulties)
to avoid/to evade/to keep away from
to recoil/to draw back/to fall back/to retreat
to jump out of the way
